InputQ: i have a speaking disorder is there surgery or medication that can help?
RealatedQ: spirometry test…last resort!
RealatedQ_question_text: Question: Spirometry test…last resort!
RealatedQ_answer: there are several factors in determining the results of a spirometry test. an fev1 and fvc at 100% and 110% do not show signs of copd but any fev1/fvc ratio of less than 70% is considered abnormal from a laboratory point of view. a doctor needs to consider the fev1/fvc ratio in his copd diagnosis.

InputQ: i acquired methicillin-resistant staphylococcus aureus (mrsa) while in hospital?
RealatedQ: my mother has “suddenly” become almost totally non talkative?
RealatedQ_question_text: My mother has “suddenly”  become  almost totally non talkative?
RealatedQ_answer: hi all her symptoms point to sepsis however i have seen same symptoms in some patients with multiple small brain stroke also regarding your tests the repeated use of anti biotics may have increased bacterial resistance usually when we do a culture we search for types of bacteria called gram positive however in rare cases the ones we ignore which are called gram negative could be the cause of the problem (extremely rare) so i recommend doing a brain mri and doing a bacterial gram negative culture. good luck

InputQ: i did xray and the findings are suspicious densities in upper right lobe?
RealatedQ: my mother has “suddenly” become almost totally non talkative?
RealatedQ_question_text: My mother has “suddenly”  become  almost totally non talkative?
RealatedQ_answer: hi all her symptoms point to sepsis however i have seen same symptoms in some patients with multiple small brain stroke also regarding your tests the repeated use of anti biotics may have increased bacterial resistance usually when we do a culture we search for types of bacteria called gram positive however in rare cases the ones we ignore which are called gram negative could be the cause of the problem (extremely rare) so i recommend doing a brain mri and doing a bacterial gram negative culture. good luck

InputQ: i had a lot abdominal pain and the blood test results for my liver were at 72?
RealatedQ: spirometry test…last resort!
RealatedQ_question_text: Question: Spirometry test…last resort!
RealatedQ_answer: there are several factors in determining the results of a spirometry test. an fev1 and fvc at 100% and 110% do not show signs of copd but any fev1/fvc ratio of less than 70% is considered abnormal from a laboratory point of view. a doctor needs to consider the fev1/fvc ratio in his copd diagnosis.

RealatedQ: i fractured my elbow should i be using an elbow brace
RealatedQ_question_text: I fractured my elbow, should I be using an elbow brace
RealatedQ_answer: if you have gained full range of motion and muscle power with physiotherapy and you are back to playing sports and feeling some pain while playing you can wear a normal elbow support to prevent sudden rotations and overloads that may cause strain or tendinitis. do not forget that always treating the cause ( muscle weakness ) is the first line of treatment … thanks

InputQ: a year ago i found a large lump top of my right breast?
RealatedQ: spirometry test…last resort!
RealatedQ_question_text: Question: Spirometry test…last resort!
RealatedQ_answer: there are several factors in determining the results of a spirometry test. an fev1 and fvc at 100% and 110% do not show signs of copd but any fev1/fvc ratio of less than 70% is considered abnormal from a laboratory point of view. a doctor needs to consider the fev1/fvc ratio in his copd diagnosis.

InputQ: i woke up on sunday morning with an awful metallic taste in my mouth?
RealatedQ: my mother has “suddenly” become almost totally non talkative?
RealatedQ_question_text: My mother has “suddenly”  become  almost totally non talkative?
RealatedQ_answer: hi all her symptoms point to sepsis however i have seen same symptoms in some patients with multiple small brain stroke also regarding your tests the repeated use of anti biotics may have increased bacterial resistance usually when we do a culture we search for types of bacteria called gram positive however in rare cases the ones we ignore which are called gram negative could be the cause of the problem (extremely rare) so i recommend doing a brain mri and doing a bacterial gram negative culture. good luck

RealatedQ: spirometry test…last resort!
RealatedQ_question_text: Question: Spirometry test…last resort!
RealatedQ_answer: there are several factors in determining the results of a spirometry test. an fev1 and fvc at 100% and 110% do not show signs of copd but any fev1/fvc ratio of less than 70% is considered abnormal from a laboratory point of view. a doctor needs to consider the fev1/fvc ratio in his copd diagnosis.

RealatedQ_answer: there are several factors in determining the results of a spirometry test. an fev1 and fvc at 100% and 110% do not show signs of copd but any fev1/fvc ratio of less than 70% is considered abnormal from a laboratory point of view. a doctor needs to consider the fev1/fvc ratio in his copd diagnosis.

InputQ: my boyfriend and i have as genotype advise how to avoid having sickle-cell disease babies?
RealatedQ: spirometry test…last resort!
RealatedQ_question_text: Question: Spirometry test…last resort!
RealatedQ_answer: there are several factors in determining the results of a spirometry test. an fev1 and fvc at 100% and 110% do not show signs of copd but any fev1/fvc ratio of less than 70% is considered abnormal from a laboratory point of view. a doctor needs to consider the fev1/fvc ratio in his copd diagnosis.

InputQ: after giving birth i continue to vomit 5 – 19 minutes after eating?

InputQ: i’m 31 years old i’ve been diagnosed with digital papillary carcinoma what are the treatments?
RealatedQ: my mother has “suddenly” become almost totally non talkative?
RealatedQ_question_text: My mother has “suddenly”  become  almost totally non talkative?
RealatedQ_answer: hi all her symptoms point to sepsis however i have seen same symptoms in some patients with multiple small brain stroke also regarding your tests the repeated use of anti biotics may have increased bacterial resistance usually when we do a culture we search for types of bacteria called gram positive however in rare cases the ones we ignore which are called gram negative could be the cause of the problem (extremely rare) so i recommend doing a brain mri and doing a bacterial gram negative culture. good luck

InputQ: i was diagnosed with pandas syndrome i often run low grade fevers have fatigue and chills?
RealatedQ: my mother has “suddenly” become almost totally non talkative?
RealatedQ_question_text: My mother has “suddenly”  become  almost totally non talkative?
RealatedQ_answer: hi all her symptoms point to sepsis however i have seen same symptoms in some patients with multiple small brain stroke also regarding your tests the repeated use of anti biotics may have increased bacterial resistance usually when we do a culture we search for types of bacteria called gram positive however in rare cases the ones we ignore which are called gram negative could be the cause of the problem (extremely rare) so i recommend doing a brain mri and doing a bacterial gram negative culture. good luck

InputQ: i am kite surf instructor but have spine condition pain too much too handle?
RealatedQ: my mother has “suddenly” become almost totally non talkative?
RealatedQ_question_text: My mother has “suddenly”  become  almost totally non talkative?
RealatedQ_answer: hi all her symptoms point to sepsis however i have seen same symptoms in some patients with multiple small brain stroke also regarding your tests the repeated use of anti biotics may have increased bacterial resistance usually when we do a culture we search for types of bacteria called gram positive however in rare cases the ones we ignore which are called gram negative could be the cause of the problem (extremely rare) so i recommend doing a brain mri and doing a bacterial gram negative culture. good luck

InputQ: my bladder feels full and burns urethra itches tests all ok?
RealatedQ: my mother has “suddenly” become almost totally non talkative?

RealatedQ_answer: hi all her symptoms point to sepsis however i have seen same symptoms in some patients with multiple small brain stroke also regarding your tests the repeated use of anti biotics may have increased bacterial resistance usually when we do a culture we search for types of bacteria called gram positive however in rare cases the ones we ignore which are called gram negative could be the cause of the problem (extremely rare) so i recommend doing a brain mri and doing a bacterial gram negative culture. good luck

InputQ: my father diagnosed with stomach cancer is not treatable please advise?
RealatedQ: i was diagnosed with crohn’s when anemic i have staph infections?
RealatedQ_question_text: I was diagnosed with crohn’s, when anemic I have staph infections?
RealatedQ_answer: i am afraid what you are doing is not going to help at all. staph infections must be treated with antibiotics that have been used as cefazolin cefuroxime cephalexin nafcillin (nallpen) oxacillin (bactocill) dicloxacillin vancomycin clindamycin (cleocin) rifampin and telavancin (vibativ). if they are resistant then expect mrsa. intravenous antibiotics could be crucial in your case. please follow up with a dermatology specialist. thanks.

RealatedQ_answer: hi all her symptoms point to sepsis however i have seen same symptoms in some patients with multiple small brain stroke also regarding your tests the repeated use of anti biotics may have increased bacterial resistance usually when we do a culture we search for types of bacteria called gram positive however in rare cases the ones we ignore which are called gram negative could be the cause of the problem (extremely rare) so i recommend doing a brain mri and doing a bacterial gram negative culture. good luck

InputQ: i have on going dull knee pains for over two years?

RealatedQ_answer: there are several factors in determining the results of a spirometry test. an fev1 and fvc at 100% and 110% do not show signs of copd but any fev1/fvc ratio of less than 70% is considered abnormal from a laboratory point of view. a doctor needs to consider the fev1/fvc ratio in his copd diagnosis.

InputQ: i was recently diagnosed with innapropriate sinus tachycardia worried heart rate will go too low?
RealatedQ: pain behind right eye blurriness headache sinus pain?
RealatedQ_question_text: Pain behind right eye, blurriness, headache, sinus pain?
RealatedQ_answer: in my opinion. it is most probably migraine headache and to a lesser extent sinusitis. a ct scan is a good diagnostic tool to rule out any other pathologies. try. triptan medications which include sumatriptan (imitrex) rizatriptan (maxalt) almotriptan (axert) naratriptan (amerge) zolmitriptan (zomig) frovatriptan (frova) and eletriptan (relpax). sleep well and drink plenty of water. if no progression then you will need to see a neurologist and ct brain is needed.

InputQ: i have been diagnosed with barrets esophagus and severe acid reflux are ppis safe for me?
RealatedQ: my mother has “suddenly” become almost totally non talkative?
RealatedQ_question_text: My mother has “suddenly”  become  almost totally non talkative?
RealatedQ_answer: hi all her symptoms point to sepsis however i have seen same symptoms in some patients with multiple small brain stroke also regarding your tests the repeated use of anti biotics may have increased bacterial resistance usually when we do a culture we search for types of bacteria called gram positive however in rare cases the ones we ignore which are called gram negative could be the cause of the problem (extremely rare) so i recommend doing a brain mri and doing a bacterial gram negative culture. good luck

InputQ: i have a rash thought it might be some type of fungus doc says ringworm?
RealatedQ: my mother has “suddenly” become almost totally non talkative?
RealatedQ_question_text: My mother has “suddenly”  become  almost totally non talkative?
RealatedQ_answer: hi all her symptoms point to sepsis however i have seen same symptoms in some patients with multiple small brain stroke also regarding your tests the repeated use of anti biotics may have increased bacterial resistance usually when we do a culture we search for types of bacteria called gram positive however in rare cases the ones we ignore which are called gram negative could be the cause of the problem (extremely rare) so i recommend doing a brain mri and doing a bacterial gram negative culture. good luck

RealatedQ_answer: hi all her symptoms point to sepsis however i have seen same symptoms in some patients with multiple small brain stroke also regarding your tests the repeated use of anti biotics may have increased bacterial resistance usually when we do a culture we search for types of bacteria called gram positive however in rare cases the ones we ignore which are called gram negative could be the cause of the problem (extremely rare) so i recommend doing a brain mri and doing a bacterial gram negative culture. good luck

RealatedQ: i have polycystic ovarian disease. can i stop my medication?
RealatedQ_question_text: Question: I have polycystic ovarian disease..can I stop my medication?
RealatedQ_answer: pcod (polycystic ovarian disease) is a chronic illness. normoz and beplex are normally prescribed to help induce regular periods and improve your chances of conceiving. usually they are prescribed for a period of 3 to 6 months. if no medication or hormones are used you will become irregular again. talk to your doctor before stopping any medication.

InputQ: an x-ray of my hand showed tendinitis and atherosclerotic calcification what should i do?

RealatedQ_question_text: My mother has “suddenly”  become  almost totally non talkative?

InputQ: i hit my head i still have the numbness in my arms and hand
RealatedQ: spirometry test…last resort!
RealatedQ_question_text: Question: Spirometry test…last resort!
RealatedQ_answer: there are several factors in determining the results of a spirometry test. an fev1 and fvc at 100% and 110% do not show signs of copd but any fev1/fvc ratio of less than 70% is considered abnormal from a laboratory point of view. a doctor needs to consider the fev1/fvc ratio in his copd diagnosis.

InputQ: my 12th week scan showed everything is o. k but radiologist suggested there is caudal regression syndrome?
RealatedQ: my mother’s left lung had collapsed but doctors don’t know why?
RealatedQ_question_text: My mother’s left lung had collapsed but doctors don’t know why?
RealatedQ_answer: hi lung collapse or pnemothorax is usually caused by injury or rib fracture but with your mum it would be of no cause due to aging or just secondary complication to chronic obstructive pulmonary disease. my advice start teaching her breathing exercises to expand the lung buy her a spirometer by which you can do biofeedback inspiration exercise to promote lung expansion. a physiotherapist may help her walk better and breath better… regards

RealatedQ_answer: hi all her symptoms point to sepsis however i have seen same symptoms in some patients with multiple small brain stroke also regarding your tests the repeated use of anti biotics may have increased bacterial resistance usually when we do a culture we search for types of bacteria called gram positive however in rare cases the ones we ignore which are called gram negative could be the cause of the problem (extremely rare) so i recommend doing a brain mri and doing a bacterial gram negative culture. good luck

InputQ: hockey player has ankle problems tenderness bruising and a good bit of swelling?
RealatedQ: i’ve had 2 knee operations knee feels like loose?
RealatedQ_question_text: I’ve had 2 knee operations, knee feels like loose?
RealatedQ_answer: you have either of those possibilities 1-chondromalacia patellae which is early arthritis of the patellofemoral joint. which can be felt as continuous crepititions with flexion or extension. 2-meniscial injury: if the clicking is one click in the range of motion from flexion to extension or vise versa. get a normal xray done and mri of knee if the case is the second one. physiotherapy is going to help you regain your strength and stability.

InputQ: i had a cat scan (ct) will radiation increase my cancer risk?
RealatedQ: my mother has “suddenly” become almost totally non talkative?
RealatedQ_question_text: My mother has “suddenly”  become  almost totally non talkative?
RealatedQ_answer: hi all her symptoms point to sepsis however i have seen same symptoms in some patients with multiple small brain stroke also regarding your tests the repeated use of anti biotics may have increased bacterial resistance usually when we do a culture we search for types of bacteria called gram positive however in rare cases the ones we ignore which are called gram negative could be the cause of the problem (extremely rare) so i recommend doing a brain mri and doing a bacterial gram negative culture. good luck

InputQ: how to control my high blood pressure?
RealatedQ: spirometry test…last resort!
RealatedQ_question_text: Question: Spirometry test…last resort!
RealatedQ_answer: there are several factors in determining the results of a spirometry test. an fev1 and fvc at 100% and 110% do not show signs of copd but any fev1/fvc ratio of less than 70% is considered abnormal from a laboratory point of view. a doctor needs to consider the fev1/fvc ratio in his copd diagnosis.
